name: Hannah Lagrone
text: I HIGHLY do not recommend going through Cumberland Homes. They put up a good front to get business from you but definitely do not care about your business. It took them almost a month and a half to set up our trailer; trim, fix cracks they put in the walls, etc. We literally had to beg, call every day, and do everything short of pulling to teeth to get them to finish setting up our trailer.  We were supposed to get a washer and dryer from them, they tried to con us out of it. We signed a contract that we had to get our own contractor to do the dirt pad.. the owner sent his family member to our house who 1. Did not know the measurements of our trailer, did a horrible job. 2. Just to try to con us out of money and we ended up having to pay another contractor to fix what they messed up. If I could give them 0 stars I definitely would. I highly suggest taking your business somewhere else. Save your money and just build a house y’all it is not worth it.

resp.text: When we trim a sheet rock house we wait until you get the power and water hooked up. it took you about 3 weeks to get the power and water to the house. When we began to trim the house, we discovered the factory did not ship all the parts, we had to order those parts. We ordered parts, received parts and trimmed your house out within two weeks of you getting power and water. You watched contractor build the site all day and at the end of the day you did not pay, and said you where not gonna pay. So that contractor did not finish. We waited on you to finish since you said that you wanted to do your own site prep. You did nothing to the site so we hired a contractor to finish the site prep. The second contractor cost about the same as what the washer and dryer cost. We asked you if you would trade the washer and dryer for site prep. So we tried to get you to pay for the site prep, you said that you would. We let you have the washer and dryer. You still have not paid for any portion of the site prep. So now you write a bad review after not paying from two different people. I would delete this review because it makes you look far worse.

name: David Mcdougal
text:
Purchased a double wide Clayton Home. We had only seen it on the video due to COVId 19. My wife spent a week (a solid 40 plus hours) trying to satisfy the requirements of the mortgage company. She couldn’t so she called to tell the salesman that we would be unable to purchase the home. He replied with, well send me what you have, I usually deal with them anyway. So the mortgage got approved. I was told by my salesman that he had gotten us approved with no payment for 90 days. One of the guys at the mortgage company actually laughed when I told him I was told 90 days no payment. We go sign papers 4/21 and cannot sign the papers in our home because they have started prepping it for delivery. We had to be out of the house we were renting so ok, this should be quick and easy. We were told a few weeks to MOVE in. It took a month just to deliver a ready home!That was 5/15. We moved in 6/10. I asked the salesman while looking him in the eyes if I would need to arrange to have the power, water, or septic tank connected. His reply to me was “no, we handle all that and it’s financed in”.
So Regional sends a man out to make our dirt pad. Supposed to be paid for in the mortgage. Guy says we need 17 loads of dirt and that we will have to either get the dirt or we could pay him around $2000 on top of what Regional was paying him for the pad work. Our lot is not that Unlevel to start with. We hired our own guy who did the pad and supplied the dirt for what Regional was going to pay their guy. They called our guy 4 times a day for a week till it got done. We are then told it was going to be another week before they delivered our home. That week comes and we are told for 5 straight days “ it’s gonna be delivered tomorrow, I promise” and it didn’t show till the end of the following week. And my wife drove an hour one way every day to meet them as she was told one of us would need to be there.So we get the septic tank installed and the water meter installed. We call our salesman to let him know and we are told that we have to provide someone to hook that up. So we get power and make the call to get our AC installed. No reply for over a week. We try to reach the general manager and can only leave messages because he is always busy and apparently doesn’t return calls between meeting (or ever). On day 3 of asking for him, the guy says, you keep calling, is there something I can help you with?. So we find out that he is the guy who arranges the AC and underpinning and finish work. He claims he hasn’t been told we had power and were ready for AC install and underpinning but he would get right on it even though three days before my wife had texted the salesman and he said he’d let them know.He called back 3 days later and said he had it set up for Monday. Monday comes and is almost gone so we call him back. He says he doesn’t know where they are and gives us the number to the AC company. They advised us that they had nothing scheduled for us to install. They simply told him they would have the unit in stock on Monday. Now the AC folks did a great job. They had a cancellation and came a day earlier than the appointment they made with us actually. I am about to make my second payment and the house is still not underpinned and we have heard nothing from the manufacturer as to when they are coming to fix all the broken drawers and the screwed up electrical. If you turn off the light outside the laundry room door to the outside, none of the lights in the living room will work.
Long story I know but I will live in a cardboard box before I buy another home from Regional Mobile Homes in Northport. We are now being told it will be another 2 to 3 weeks before they come do our underpinning. Oh and there is absolutely nothing holding this home to the ground. No straps or anchors. The Alabama Mobile Home  commission  says that it acceptable , but I have never seen a mobile home in Alabama that wasn’t strapped and anchored. They will do the minimum they can do. Not above and beyond like they say on the website. I wish I could give them negative stars.

resp.text: Hey David - I’m sorry you were unhappy with the service you received at Regional Homes. Our number one priority is to meet and exceed expectations at every interaction. Since we don’t have much control over the manufacturer servicing, we do everything in our power to get issues resolved for you quickly but that’s not always the case. We will keep working hard to get these issues taken care of more promptly!

name: kayla gough
text:
0/5.
Very uncoordinated and no communication between employees. Very frustrating! Our sales person, James, was not knowledgeable enough to be on his own yet and got openly angry and upset that we had questions and asked for clarification on important steps. Financial person, Heath, flat out stated that they didnt care about our business because they were busy already. Information about the buying process was not shared up front. And prices 'increase' suspiciously. We even called other companies to check this info and this was not the case. Beware! Buying a home is a HUGE decision that costs a lot of money! these people are not professional and are not trustworthy. Go somewhere else!

This company will waste your time and are sleazy as grease. dont let them get a hold of your money! We were almost ready to sign with them after months of strained communication and a growing uneasy feeling in my gut, when they threw out some pretty big requirements we were never told about over 6 months of talking and preparing for a real, serious home purchase. contractors were lined up and everything. We were told prices had increased magically per foot in the house the week prior and that it required a 10% deposit on the value of the home before building...we called around to other mobile home sites and they reacted like this was the normal, to get these phone calls about this company, Cumberland Homes. Evidently we are not the first people they have done this to. the other mobile home companies in Alabama STRONGLY cautioned us that no prices had changed due to the annual convention, everything was status quo, and what they are suggesting is an unethical and NOT practiced requirement of a 10% deposit on top of the down payment for your home mortgage. You have been warned, people.

**update in response to company comment**
no sir, I am simply being thorough in my review. i have not used any "fictitious name". i simply left the same review on facebook and google. what my review states is truth. you seem to be having the tantrum because people are responding to my review with similar experiences until you took down the reviews on facebook. Let me be clear. I am not worried about you. I have not given you a second thought. i simply shared my experience to warn others. looks like yall are still stuck on it. interesting. you can speak whatever things that make you sleep better at night. I am not bitter, I am not mad, i am simply sharing the truth. I am GLAD it didnt work out now. you can excuse what you did all the ways you wish, you cannot take it back. STOP WASTING MY TIME AND MAKING YOURSELF EVEN LESS PROFESSIONAL. learn from your actions. evidently yall have reputation  that follows your company name. so sad.

Also, the "cousin" you mentioned is aware of everything and has been very cautious with you. he stayed simply because of pricing, not because he was impressed by your business. i hope you treated him better, though! it seems like it. Learning from mistakes is great.

Lastly, something to note. I only add more detail to my review when you respond unprofessionally....

resp.text: Ok,   You have already left one Review under a fictitious name and used the same type rhetoric.  Concerning the price increases,  Different Manufactured home dealers have different business arrangements with the factories based on volume and other factors so you have no idea as to what you are talking about concerning our pricing or any other Manufactured Home dealership.  Look Kayla we made a decision not to do business with you based on your behavior is the truth of the matter and this type of response from you just validates our decision.  What it seems like you are doing is simply having a tantrum because you didn't get your way.  No company wants to turn down business for obvious reasons but in your case we felt we had no choice.  Yes deposits are required on special order homes that nobody else would ever want if for some reason you can't or don't go through with the purchase is not unreasonable in our opinion.  This is the type of behavior that helped us make a decision not to do business with you and we don't regret that decision by any means.   It seems like the timing of this review is very suspicious since your cousins home will be delivering very soon and they have been very reasonable and great to work with through the whole process and we truly hope they enjoy their new home for many years to come.  We also would like to thank you for referring them to us.  Once their home is delivered we will mail your referral check.   Good luck to you in the future,  best wishes..

name: MIKE HEMPHILL
text: Terrible experience, salesman only contacted us when we needed to pay, called and left messages for him and they weren't returned. Had to contact deer valley ourselves to get the information on what it took to get the contractor in to finish. I've been treated better by used car salesman than this group of disrespectful people.

resp.text: Mr. Hemphill I am sorry that the salesman did not communicate with you the details of when your house would be finished. We have spoken with him about always communicating with the customer, He has made a mistake and I hope this mistake will not be made again. I know you are proud of the quality of your house and the great service work Deer Valley provides, I wish our sales crew would have did a better job of taken care of you.

name: Anise Morris
text: Terrible customer service. Our company buys lots of used mobile homes and we have never had an experience like this one. We wrote a check for the entire price of the mobile home based on promises made by Ron Davis. (1) He stated all appliances in good order but oven did not work-they replaced but we had to wait 1 month for replacement stove to be delivered because he apparently never ordered it; (2) Freezer worked but not refrigerator-they offered a used refrigerator but we had to pick up and install if we wanted it replaced; (3) We paid extra for skirting-took over a month for it to be installed; (4) All plumbing valves missing-out of pocket cost for repairs; (5) They lost keys to mobile home and promised to replace locks but never did; another out of pocket cost. This company seems to be only interested in making the sale but not servicing the customer. Buy elsewhere.

resp.text: I am sorry that you are unsatisfied with your used house. The house did not come with cut off valves when it was built 25 years ago. You told me the stove did not work even though we dont carry warranties on the appliances , we bought one from Lowes but they could not get in touch with you to deliver with the phone number you gave me. A month later you said the fridge did not work, so I replied that you could replace it with another if you wanted to pick it up. Send me a bill for the keys and I will refund your out of pocket cost. I did not know you did not have keys.

name: Compare and Save on Manufactured Homes
text: We have found these home to be the most energy efficient and best priced.

resp.text: Thanks

name: Cheryl Hunnicutt
text: An awful experience that we want to put behind us! DeerValley has been helpful, just wish I could say the same about Wes Madison and Cumberland.

resp.text: Cheryl if you would have asked for a heat pump we would have gladly got one for you,  you did not ask for a heat pump, you were not charged for one. That is contracted out through a different company. Cumberland Homes does not install the heating and cooling systems. And yes your house did get a leak in the plastic when it was on the lot but the factory striped everything down to the studs and replaced what ever was damaged, there is no mildew in your house ever thing that was damaged was replaced, As far as delivery, YOUR COUSIN  delivered the house, he was in charge of scheduling when he could deliver your house and it was wet the entire time he was trying to deliver. Your house had to be pulled in with a skider and your entire site had to be matted because it was so wet, that is why it took him longer to deliver. I have been out to your house to see the issues that you are speaking of, and the factory is scheduled to take care of your issues. Deer Valley is the best built house on the market, Your house is energy star compatible, thermal zone III, heat shield on the roof, Low E gold seal thermal Croft Windows. Your house  is built to conserve on heating and cooling.

name: Heather Alford
text: We tossed around the idea of a "mobile home" as it's far more affordable. However not all of these homes are created equal. They can be beautiful on the inside but very cheaply made. What's in the walls and structure counts big time. That being said, if you're considering this type of option, skip Clayton (subpar materials, building standards, still stuck in the 90s), and go here and opt for a Deer Valley home. Built w 2x6 beams, hella thick insulation, you can have recessed lighting, sheetrock walls, 9ft ceilings, the list goes on. In Alabama that wind rating is going to matter. In most brands if you want these options you're gonna pay the price like punishment for wanting a higher standard. I'll let my pictures speak for themselves on what you get for your money. Worth a look. And our salesman was no pressure but very professional. That matters bc they can usually be as bad as used car salesmen.

resp.text: Thanks for your rating and paying attention to how our homes are made.  Very educated buyer you are.

text: Would have rated them 5 stars until delivery.  Excellent service and ability to provide the custom plans we requested. Impressed with the great quality of the home.  Unfortunately, six months post delivery we have still been unable to get anyone to come out to do the post delivery touch up work.  We paid for upgrades that we did not get and we have cracked dry wall throughout the house (expected after transport) that they promised would be repaired.  Many of the lighting fixtures were not installed, were broken, or completely missing.  Outdoor faucet is leaking and needs fixed before freezing weather. Several small things that will get bigger if not fixed soon.  Very disappointed and frustrated with lack of follow through.

resp.text: I am sorry you have some issues but you did not contact us until Dec, After you notified us that you had some issues, I contacted the factory. The factory took care of all your issues by February according to you. I asked if there was anything else you needed and you said you were 100% satified.

name: Olive Oyl
text: If I could give NO stars, I would. Dealing with this company has been nothing but headaches from day one! Regardless of how many times one calls for service calls, the requests are ignored. From the time the down payment was made until today, the buyer is ignored. The salesman and the office manager made promises they knew they would not keep and the buyer is left out to dry. This experience has been a NIGHTMARE!  There is NO way that I would recommend Regional Homes!

resp.text: I'm sorry to hear you were unhappy with the services you received at Regional Homes Cullman. Our number one priority is to meet and exceed expectations at every interaction. Since we don't have much control over the manufacturer servicing, we do everything in our power to get issues resolved for you quickly but that's not always the case. We will keep working hard to get these issues taken care of more promptly!

resp.text: Thank you so much Lynn for the kind words and great review! We appreciate it and happy to hear you had a great experience with us!

name: Steven Schrimsher
text:
Update - 5 months later
The A/C got installed on Memorial Day (major kudos to the guy who drove out to install the crossover on the holiday and for that I'm returning 1 star, however that situation should've never happened in the first place). Underpinning got installed approx 1 month later.

There are repairs that are needed now which should fall under warranty, however I am not confident they will do quality work ("they gave us a bad review, so we'll do just enough" type of deal). That said, who knows - maybe things have changed internally and they'd see this as an opportunity.

A lot of the headache around our purchase (and the subsequent bad review) probably could have been avoided with better communication both internally (within their company) and externally (with contractors they hired and with us). Buyer beware is all I can say. If you go with them, I hope you have a better experience than we did. While I still don't necessarily recommend them I do hope that, in the months since we purchased, they have been able to fix whatever issues caused the hiccups with our experience and provide a better product for future customers.

Original review:
AVOID THIS PLACE. Our experience declined when they ceased to be Dream Home Outlet and became regional homes of Cullman. Been waiting months to get into our house because their installers can't do anything right (no AC in half our home because they forgot the crossovers, AC unit installed in an improper location, water crossovers improperly installed, missing door hardware, etc). We have been patient about waiting but enough is enough. The goalposts keep moving- first it was one day, then two days, then weeks. Shame that I can't even live in the house that I'm already making payments on. Moe, Wendy, and Les are all decent enough people but there's a major hangup somewhere for these types of issues to be so prevalent, and because of that (in addition to the lack of requested -repeatedly- communication) I cannot recommend anyone go here when looking for their new home.

AVOID AVOID AVOID

resp.text: Hey Steven. I understand your frustration and we want you to know customer service is extremely important to us. We're putting pressure on the manufacturers and are doing everything we can to help your situation. Please give us a call as soon as possible so we can get any outstanding issues resolved.

text: My wife and I stopped here today to try and look at a few different models. With the kids gone we were unsure about how many bedrooms to get or what kind of house to do. Today’s experience pretty well sealed the deal with staying away from a manufactured house. It was not a welcoming we expected and instead felt like a used car buying experience. The guy wanted to get info from us that we were not certain of yet and wasn’t happy with our time frame of inside of two years. When we told him we just wanted to look he replied back with, “ we only have two sales people and looking at all of them could take all day” being a business owner my self, if it takes me all day to make the customer happy, then so be it. We drove away, both telling each other that our business will stay far away from this place even if it means spending more money to do so.

name: Terry Butler (Butler Team Roping)
text: Very bad customer service. Apparently you're not allowed to look at the homes without a salesperson opening every home for you one at a time. I've never seen that before. My husband and I waited in the office and walked around looking for someone. Of the several people that were in the office, no one acknowledged us. They just kept their eyes on their computer screens. We finally found another person on a tour and inquired about looking at houses. She gave us a quick reply that they were all locked and we couldn't look with out someone. There was no effort made to point us toward someone. I understand the houses being locked; however, if policy requires that someone open each house for perspective buyers, there should be sales people visible and available to speak with them. I've been to several Clayton Homes sales lots and have been given keys to open the homes and look at them at my own pace. They gave me a card and made sure I understood that they were there to answer any questions we had.  I personally do not like to have someone with me every step. I prefer to take my time and look at each home and weigh out the pros and cons and then speak with someone and ask questions. I can imagine this place had lost a considerable amount of business with this practice in place.

resp.text:
Hi Terry,

Thank you for your feedback. At Clayton Homes of Athens, we try to make sure all of our customers are helped right away and are given tours of all of the homes so we are available to answer any questions.  Our sales consultants also point out quite a few helpful features of our homes that you might not be aware of, such as our energy efficient windows and water heaters.  We also always keep our homes locked so they are protected for their future owner—we want to make sure everyone has a beautiful home. I’m sorry that you did not have a good experience this time. I would be happy to talk to you more about it, so please give me a call at 256-233-3101 at your convenience. Thank you! Roddy, General Manager

name: Tracey Dildine
text:
After walking through the of the sales office Terra said with notepad in hand. Good morning, have you been here before? We said no,and was going to say " we just want to look around"  and she immediately charged us through to an office, told us to fill out a form so we could see houses. We stated we had seen the houses on line and there was one in particular we wanted see, we were so excited to know there was one locally as we were possibly moving to VA in the near future Then she said, "well if your not going to buy from Us then Im not showing you any homes, as we have to be here for our customers that are going to buy for us, we have had 7 customers this morning and dont have time for you if your not buying. My jaw hit the floor. My husband ripped up the form and said lets go. I thought for a minute she was joking, but the look on her face was that of disgust for us asking to view the home. He walked out, I asked her seriously you not going to show us 2 homes? She said no and walked out. All this happened within the first minute of the conversation.
Disgusted and appalled at her lack of customer service skills and thoughtlessness  for people wanting ideas for their home, I can honestly say she should be fired. I have never been spoken to like that before. My husband, being in the AF for 21 years was looking for a place we could settle down in, but it won't be from your company. We then wandered around the lot, going over in our heads "did we do something wrong" and found Jennifer moving furnture we asked if we could poke our heads in the door and she was very kind enough to let us. We then saw another sales person, Mary Jane and she was unlocking the house we were so excited to see. I asked her if she minded us looking inside and she was most pleasant and said of course, not "are you buying from us, not, sign this first", just great customer service. Thank you for teaching that sales person some respect of others.
We then went over to the green house as Terra had just gone in, and I tried the door handle, and it was locked! She came to the door and held it so close to her that I couldnt see inside if I wanted too. She said if you go back to the office and sign the form I will let you see the houses, I asked "did you seriously lock the door so I couldnt poke my head in the door" she replied "yes". Again, floored by her attitude and I laughed out loud because it was just so childish. I hope her customers knew they were locked in with her!  She then said I have nothing more to say, and shut the door in my face!
Apparently at some point In the office I used the word "darn or dam" as I was so disgusted by our treatment, and she said you can go now, I won't have someone cussing at me. I'm from England and this isn't particularly a cuss word.
To summarise for those of you thinking of buying from Clayton Homes in Athens dont bother. You may get lucky enough to speak with Mary Jane or you may get Terra. Good luck. Yes, I have a call in to the boss Roddy and yes I will be notifying the better business bureau. We are no headed to Mundy homes to find our forever home...
Tracey.

text: We went to Clayton Homes because of the good reputation and advertisement. The lady that helped us, Jeanie I think, was very nice and helpful. She wasn't a pushy salesperson; she let us look around and talk to each other and think about it with out trying to force anything on us. That being said, it went downhill after that. Tuesday we called again and they tell us that it is on the way while we're both at work. So he had to leave work since no one gave us a heads up. There are still drawers for the kitchen and light fixtures sitting in the living room floor, there are some minor flaws in the structure, the crew littered all over our yard (water bottles, bolts, screws, pieces of metal), we have no steps and it'll be a week tomorrow that it was delivered. We're having to climb in and out using a 5 gallon bucket. After the delivery we were told people would be back and we should get a phone call, that hasn't happened yet. We paid upfront and they acted like since they got their money we meant nothing any more. I would not recommend this place.

name: Trina Hedquist
text:
Let me tell you all about how they flipped my mom's life upside down. Let me take a minute, just sit right there. I'll tell you how this business made my mom pull out her hair. (figuratively)

Let's start with Wayne (who is apparently fired and so is his manager) who signed a deal with my mom assuring her they could purchase her property of choice and put the property and trailer together. My mother was approved for an FHA loan and we found the PERFECT property. They told us they got the property owner to lower the price to 20K but really and secretly Wayne had it to 15,500.... not sure if his shady ways was what got him fired but I would say it's a good bet..... anyway... Wayne "forgot" to send the money for escrow to the property owner. They were supposed to close on the property on a Thursday in the beginning of April of 2021. The DAY BEFORE CLOSING ON THE PROPERTY we find out that Wayne didn't fill out any information for the corporate office to take care of closing info and he just "forgot" all about the closing at all. So then the seller of the property raised his fee (understandably) back to original cost and made big demands for the runaround.

Then we find out that Wayne is fired later and that his manager is too. Now we are told that they are going to put my mom with another guy named Austin (not the manager Austin) who allegedly is the FHA guy on the site. Well my mom already had a lender and was approved. This company INSISTS they will not buy the property unless she uses THEIR lender. And not to worry they do FHA. HA! Here's the rub this place is running the show like a used cars salesman and trying to wrangle deals that can't work for my mom. Her FHA was for 3.5% down...now they want 10% even though she is in the right score for the 3.5%. They tried to say she doesn't qualify or for the right amount her lender said she did. But my mom and brother were doing it together. In the meantime, they are REFUSING to buy this property they originally assured her they could buy with HER LENDER....suddenly that is no longer something they can do.

They want to force my mom off the FHA loan because they don't make as much and they can't add "points" to make money off of. I am not fooled. I worked in the housing industry. Most people buying modular and mobile are lower incomes and this company is using used car, predatory lending practices and it's gross. My mom had been looking for a house since FEBRUARY. It was going to be her very first home ever buying. She was so excited and this entire process has soured everything and she still doesn't have her home or her property and now has to just keep looking for a home because we refuse to let her do business with this shady company who was just looking to prey on my mom's limited knowledge on mortgages to their advantage. Do not go here. If you are lower income, this isn't the place for you. They have zero integrity and no transparency. Run as fast as you can the other way.

resp.text: Hi Trina, thanks for sharing your experience with us. Customer service is of the upmost importance to us and we take feedback very seriously. Can you please give us a call at 1-877-264-2812 so we can document your concerns? We'd like to loop in the appropriate parties here at the home office for support.

To this day I am not in my home. Several promises were made about when I was going to be in my home. The first date was Thanksgiving that was a fail, then it was a promise to move in by Christmas. So, Thanksgiving and Christmas has come and gone! With that being said, I am still not in my home and very dissatisfied with my home.
There are numerous defects and flaws in my home. I feel that you have let me down as a company. With me moving in that means that I am NOT satisfied with the work that is done at the home.
I have exalted other means to communicate the importance of getting my home completed.

text: It was easy and simple experience they treated me like I was a king and showed me the true value way. I enjoyed meeting everyone and with the warranty they offer everything is taken care of while I settled in to my new home.

text: Austin Lesley is a truly professional and knowledgeable GM, even though he has a lot on his shoulders everything we have asked of him he has made sure we were satisfied. I would recommend this place to everyone. All the people who works there is super nice and professional!

name: Ricky Lester
text: These guys don't even deserve a star period especially if your a cash buyer . It has been a nightmare from hell . I advise anyone that's in the market for a mobile home to keep on looking elsewhere . The quality , Craftsmanship and most of all honesty doesn't exist at all ! But you can get a better price here , but trust me in all aspects ....it will cost you a whole lot more in the long run. If your a out of state purchaser,  stay away from here please because when you've had enough of they're BS and your ready to hire an attorney,  you'll have to do so in the state of Al ! Luckily I found one that's very aware of they're way of conducting business and was more than happy to take on the case . I'll be posing the outcome of this issue as this matter is handled in court . And please , keep all your paperwork,  documentations as I luckily did and even if you have to wear a recording device  I strongly recommend it because you'll need it .

resp.text:
Hi Ricky-
Thank you for your feedback. I would like to get more information about your visit to our location, Tru Value Homes. Please give me a call at 256-820-0510 at your earliest convenience. Thank you and I hope to hear from you soon! -Austin Lesley, G.M. Tru Value Homes

text: Stay away from this place! Everybody that work there are biggest lier in Calhoun also! They you a lie to your face! NOTHING BUT LIER!!!! You save money anywhere else. And other places tell you the truth.

text: We just purchase our home ....the process was horrible we were given false info...they told us things like we wont have a payment till feb ...they never installed our steps we had to get temorary steps made to move in ....even after they finished the underpin (which Took them forever to come and do ) they never installed our steps we still do not have back steps ..the inside of my home was put together Poorly ...it was just a mess everything from the beginning to the end ...i told my husband about the reviews before we closed but he felt we were in to deep and stuck ...but this was just the worse dec ever  ...do not use them

text: This place is an absolute JOKE. My mother recently purchased a new home from them and the entire experience was a total NIGHTMARE. The manager Austin will tell you whatever you need to hear to not have to deal with you and should be absolutely ashamed of himself for running a "business" the way that he does. We wish we would have seen their google rating before we started down this road, as we are certainly not the only dissatisfied customers. JUST LOOK ELSEWHERE.

Hi Tammy,
I appreciate your review. Your feedback is extremely valuable to us, as we strive to improve with each and every day. I would like to talk to you more about it, so please give me a call at 256-820-0510 so we can review the problem. Thank you! -Austin Lesley, G.M.

text: We are buying a repo. We've had it since May and still haven't received the skirting and have found mold 2 months ago and our fireplace pours everytime it rains. Thank God for the mortgage company because they are going to have our stuff fixed where TruValue should have stepped up! The guys at Truvalue, overall are good people but they don't do what they should or say they will.

name: Valerie Beasley
text: The sale rep.  Helen was excellent. Unfortunately she is not there now. She answered all calls day and night. Once they got my mom to sign on the dotted line, she was lied to repeatedly about someone coming out to fix the repairs that was done through manufacturing or during transport of the trailer. She has had the trailer since October or November of 2020 and I have been calling repeatedly to get someone to come out and make repairs. Who wants to live in a used trailer and paying for a new trailer.

resp.text: Hey Valerie, I'm sorry to hear that you were unhappy with the service you received at Regional Home of Mobile. Our number one priority is to meet and exceed expectations at every interaction. Since we don't have much control over the manufacturer servicing, we do everything in our power to get issues resolved for you quickly but that's not always the case. We will keep working hard to get these issues taken care of more promptly!

name: candice harrison
text: It is going on month three of owning my home and I can say that not one room in my home is complete. The sales rep Tiffany was helpful in the purchasing process but once your passed off emails & phone calls are returned at their convenience! however I took it upon myself to mail over 30 pictures of the horrible craftsmanship done to each home office. Because I have without a doubt fell through the cracks with Regional & Cappaert Homes!! Never Again!!

resp.text: Hey Candice - we apologize for any inconvenience. Please give our main office number a call and ask to speak with the General Manager, Sean, and he will help you get this taken care of. Customer Service is our #1 priority.

name: Rhonda Edwards
text: Quite a bit to choose from, but then we're in the middle of a pandemic, so to order what you want would take nearly 4 to 6 months. Also, they are in such demand, that they won't consider a cash discount...cuz they can get whatever price they put on 'em... And even if that's the case, why would you admit that? And while we're on the subject of a pandemic, I think this would be a good time to "work" out a good deal with us hard working folks who are struggling right now...not price gouging!!! Just sayin'!!!

name: Tonya Lockett-Shamburger
text: I am completely not satisfied with how this process has went. We purchased our home in January it was delivered in February here it is August and they  regional or cappaert have not completed or tried to complete our beautiful home that wasn't cheap. We have been more than patient and understanding we haven't received not one phone call.  After letting them know our home  wasn't completed. After leaving messages. I have called, emailed, & sent pictures of the incomplete work. I can say that not one room in my home is complete.  Cappaert called  in July to see  if we were enjoying our new home. I told them its not completed.I sent  pictures of the horrible craftsmanship done. Walls separated, nails sticking out trimming coming apart . Didnt receive the kitchen Drawers cabinets coming loose from the wall. I have a 11 month old & this new home we purchased isn't safe .  Haven't heard anything else from them.I'm so disappointed with Regional & Cappaert Homes!! Never Again!! The only thing I'm satisfied with is The sales rep Helen was awesome in the purchasing process helped any way she could any time of day & night due to my work schedule to get me my HOME & in my home NO complaints with her. I thank her for her time. If everyone else would do what they suppose to do. Im not asking for anything extra. I just want my home completed correctly. I don't know what else to do. Who else to call & they don't give me the run around. please just complete the work.

resp.text: Hey Tonya, I’m sorry you were unhappy with the service you received at Regional Holmes. Our number one priority is to meet and exceed expectations at every interaction. Since we don’t have much control over the manufacturer servicing, we do everything in our power to get issues resolved for you quickly but that’s not always the case. name: holly campbell
text: We have had our manufactured home for a year now and I can say I am completely not satisfied with how this whole process has went.been lied to multiple time,and they had workers in our home making repairs,so they called it but made it ten times worse!! Our home does not look brand new it looks like a used home,it was in perfect shape when we looked at it on the lot.we have had people out here 5 times to work on it and fix it and it still is not done!!! Plus all the baseboards around the windows along the floor and ceiling are messed up and even cabinets look bad because someone decided to use flat paint on the shiny parts so we have patches throughout our whole house,plus our front door is not leveled and it is crooked. If we could go back in time I would definitely of not bought a home from here. I wish they would fix what needs to be done instead of saying they can't do it.

resp.text: Hey Holly - I’m sorry you were unhappy with the service you received at Regional Homes in Mobile. Our number one priority is to meet and exceed expectations at every interaction. Since we don’t have much control over the manufacturer servicing, we do everything in our power to get issues resolved for you quickly but that’s not always the case. We will keep working hard to get these issues taken care of more promptly!

text: My husband and I had the best experience.. We just purchased our forever home two weeks ago. Tiffany and Vic are awesome. They went above and beyond in helping me choose the right home. I'm so glad I decided to stop there...

resp.text: Thank you so much for the great review!

name: John Chessher
text: My wife and I were treated like family from the time we got there. We met with our saleswoman and told her what we were looking for. It didn't take us long to find our new home but we wanted to change the inside colors and I wanted to change the outside color. And then the process began, Our 2019 28×56 was special ordered and built to what we like. Thank you Mrs.Tiffany (Our saleswoman) and Mrs. Connie and last but definitely not least Mr.Richie. All of you made our dream of owning a brand new home come true. Thanks again.

resp.text: Thank you so much John - it was a pleasure!

name: Rebekah Richerson
text: Do not recommend buying from them! They will lie and tell you exactly what you want to hear and promise you things that will not happen! All they care about is getting their money and then the lies come out. I have tried contacting the general manager but he has never called me back. Worst experience ever. Save your self some trouble and go somewhere else!!

resp.text: Hi Rebekah - We're very sorry about your experience. Would you mind calling our office at 251-649-2077?

name: Sandy Stamper
text: Would not recommend this place to anyone. They are not true to there word with fixing the things that have went wrong. My daughter bought a home from them and it has been nothing but a headache trying to get them to fix the problems . Home is very unlevel, the doors have inch gapps in them, rain water coming threw back door, one room has to have new paneling due to it being so unlevel. It's just horrible that my child works so hard for what she has and then you have sorry buisnesses like this that don't care...

resp.text: Sandy - we apologize for any inconvenience. Please give our main office number a call and ask to speak with the General Manager, Sean, and he will help you get this taken care of. Customer Service is our #1 priority.

name: Jodie McKinley
text:
We are shopping for a new mobile home and this is the first place we visited. After talking to Tiffany, she steered us in the right direction and gave us ideas on which homes we’d probably like to look at first. It was a Saturday and this place was super busy. We had made an appointment but it was apparent that Tiffany was overwhelmed with customers and she was unable to give us much of her time (although not her fault, she was there with only one other guy who didn’t seem to know much about anything). We were able to tour the homes at our leisure and their houses are all high end and very nice. There was no pressure to purchase anything.

I deducted a point for the state of their sales “yard”. It is packed dirt pocked full of dips and holes and loose gravel so make sure you wear good comfortable shoes. If I was the owner I would make repairs to this area as it’s a liability waiting to happen (I almost sprained my ankle twice) and it doesn’t look nice.

resp.text: Hey Jodie - thanks for your honest opinion! We are aware that the lot yard needs some maintenance and are planning on having that fixed very soon!

name: Christian Cunningham
text: I only give one star because i have to in order to give a review. We heard so many good things about this company and thats why we went with them; however, I regret that every single day. We have been having our home going on 3 months and it has yet to be fixed. They bent our frame, the walls have buckles in them, our house isnt even leveled. Ive tried to contaxt them over and over and no one replies. Tiffany was an outstanding sales rep and she definitely made us feel at ease with everything. However, the depts above her including the general manager is only worried about money. Looks as if we will have to get a lawyer involved just to get our home repaired.

resp.text: Sandy - we apologize for any inconvenience. Please give our main office number a call and ask to speak with the General Manager, Sean, and he will help you get this taken care of. Customer Service is our #1 priority.
